result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J Strobach was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael J Strobach in court, in custody with attorney Brian T. Kane. Prosecuting District Attorney (DA) Louis Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Kane states the count was to be amended to drop the modifier. DA Molepske doesn't object and requests it be amended on the record. 
BY THE COURT: 961.48(1)(b) 2nd offense is removed from the charge.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: Amended Charge w/o the modifier: No Contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

DA Molepske makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Kane concurs with joint agreement.  

BY THE COURT:
Withheld Sentence (3 days jail credit)
Probation for 24 months, may transfer to the county of his residence.

Conditions of Probation:
Pay costs + surcharges. Bond on file to be applied.
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations and counseling. 
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment.
Participate and comply in any other counseling as recommended by the Agent.  

Appeal rights information sheet provided.
Plea/Sentencing Hearing set for 09/07/18 - not deliverable as addressed
Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Prosequendum with attached Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Prosequendum /s/ RJS 07/13/18

records.addlTxt: Atty John Bliss appointed
Arraignment on April 25, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Michael J Strobach in court with attorney John Bliss. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

3:32 p.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

BTC:
Bond and conditions of bond continued  Arraignment scheduled for April 25, 2016 at 10:30 am.
